rand-althor.name: Rand al'Thor
aliases: He Who Comes With the Dawn

1.description: Leading the Aiel across the Dragonwall to fight the Shaido rebellion. Struggling with the weight of command.

30.description: Battles Rahvin in Tel'aran'rhiod and the real world simultaneously, using balefire to devastating effect.

52.description: Kills Rahvin with balefire, unmaking his recent actions and bringing Mat and Aviendha back from fate.

1.description: Reluctantly serves as one of Rand's generals, using his ancient memories to plan military campaigns.

44.description: Leads cavalry charges in the Battle of Cairhien, proving his tactical genius despite his reluctance.

52.description: Confronted by Rahvin's lightning but brought back when Rand's balefire unraveled the ancient enemy's recent actions.

1.description: Travels with Rand as assigned by the Wise Ones, though their relationship remains hostile and tense.

31.description: Her relationship with Rand becomes romantic despite her attempts to maintain distance and honor.

52.description: Confronted by Rahvin but brought back when balefire unraveled time, experiencing both fate and resurrection.

12.description: Training intensively with the Wise Ones, learning both channeling and dreamwalking in Tel'aran'rhiod.

37.description: Fights Lanfear in Tel'aran'rhiod, proving her growing skill and courage in the World of Dreams.

8.description: Travels with Valan Luca's traveling show as cover while continuing to hunt Black Ajah members.

34.description: Battles Moghedien in Tel'aran'rhiod, matching the ancient enemy's power through anger and determination.

8.description: Disguised as a performer in the traveling show, using her noble training to help navigate politics.

49.description: Learns that Rahvin has taken control of Andor and her mother through Compulsion weaves.

1.description: Continues to advise Rand while dealing with the complexities of Aiel politics and warfare.

52.description: Sacrifices herself by tackling Lanfear through the twisted doorway, saving Rand but disappearing from the world.
The Warder bond is severed when Moiraine faces danger/disappears. Myrelle holds his bond as arranged by Moiraine.

1.description: Serves as Rand's reluctant teacher in channeling, disguised as the gleeman Jasin Natael.

56.description: Found fallen in Caemlyn, confronted by an unknown assassin. His teaching of Rand is complete.

1.description: Leads the Shaido in rebellion against Rand, claiming to be the true Car'a'carn with fake dragon marks.

44.description: Confronted by Mat in the Battle of Cairhien, ending the Shaido rebellion and his false claim to leadership.

20.description: Couladin's wife and ambitious woman who pushes the Shaido toward greater conflict and conquest.

44.description: After Couladin's fate, takes control of the Shaido and continues their aggressive campaigns.

1.description: Serves as one of Rand's most trusted advisors and military leaders among the Aiel clans.
Tomanelle clan chief who supports Rand as Car'a'carn in the campaign against the Shaido.

8.description: Owner and manager of a traveling menagerie. Vain and dramatic, but sconfronted at entertainment business.

25.description: Becomes infatuated with Nynaeve, pursuing her romantically despite her clear disinterest.

8.description: The strongman of Luca's show. Gentle giant who performs feats of strength for amazed crowds.
Tightrope walker in the show. Married to Petra despite their physical differences.
Former Seanchan sul'dam now working as animal trainer. Keeps her past secret from most.

30.description: Her Seanchan background is revealed when she recognizes cultural elements and tries to contact her people.

8.description: Bear trainer in the show, married to Olver. Strong-willed woman who controls dangerous animals.
Bear trainer married to Latelle. Works with dangerous animals in the traveling show.
Traveling with the show as cover, performing as a gleeman while helping hunt Black Ajah.
Thief-catcher disguised as a circus performer, using his investigative skills to help the mission.

34.description: Hero of the Horn ripped from Tel'aran'rhiod and given physical form. Legendary archer now flesh and blood.

50.description: Bonded as Warder to Elayne to save her life, creating an unusual Warder bond with the Daughter-Heir.

32.description: Now a Child of the Light (Whitecloak), having joined them in his quest to do what is right.
Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, master strategist planning to use chaos to his advantage.
High-ranking Whitecloak officer serving under Pedron Niall. Ambitious and politically minded.

26.description: Deposed as Amyrlin Seat and stilled by Elaida's coup. Now powerless but still determined to fight.

50.description: Healed of being stilled by Nynaeve, though at reduced strength. Works with rebel Aes Sedai in Salidar.

26.description: Former Keeper of the Chronicles, deposed and stilled along with Siuan. Maintains her dignity despite loss.

50.description: Healed of stilling by Nynaeve. Her personality changes dramatically, becoming more flirtatious and bold.

26.description: Led coup against Siuan, becoming new Amyrlin Seat. Rules White Tower with iron fist and growing paranoia.
White Ajah sister who becomes Keeper of Chronicles under Elaida. Secretly Black Ajah and manipulates events.

48.description: Blue Ajah sister who leads the rebel Aes Sedai in Salidar against Elaida's rule of the White Tower.
Blue Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels, working to oppose Elaida's illegitimate rule.
White Ajah sister with the Salidar rebels. Known for her logical approach and cool demeanor.
Gray Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Specializes in legal matters and negotiations.
Green Ajah sister with multiple Warders among the Salidar rebels. Known for her beauty and passion.

52.description: Receives Lan's Warder bond when Moiraine faces danger, as pre-arranged by Moiraine to save his life.

48.description: Brown Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Scholar and researcher working against Elaida.

37.description: Most powerful of the female ancient enemy, obsessed with Lews Therin/Rand. Battles in Tel'aran'rhiod.

52.description: Confronted when Moiraine tackles her through the twisted doorway ter'angreal, both disappearing from the world.

49.description: ancient enemy who has taken control of Andor by putting Queen Morgase under Compulsion and ruling through her.

52.description: Confronted by Rand's balefire in their battle above Caemlyn. His fate unravels his recent actions through time.

34.description: Battles Nynaeve in Tel'aran'rhiod and is defeated, then tortured by pulling Birgitte from the World of Dreams.

41.description: One of the ancient enemy who has taken control of Illian. Former Age of Legends general and rival to Lews Therin.

1.description: Wise One of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. One of Egwene's teachers in dreamwalking.
Ancient Wise One of the Haido sept, Shae'en M'taal. Cannot channel but is sconfronted in Tel'aran'rhiod.
Wise One of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. Young and sometimes sharp-tempered, teaches Egwene.
Wise One of the Black Rock sept of the Nakai Aiel. Participates in teaching and Aiel decisions.
Wise One of the Jarra sept of the Chareen Aiel. One of the most respected and influential Wise Ones.
Clan chief of the Goshien Aiel. Tall even for an Aielman, supports Rand as Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Nakai Aiel. One of the chiefs who acknowledges Rand as the Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel. Another of the chiefs following the chosen one into the wetlands.
Clan chief of the Chareen Aiel. Participates in the council of chiefs supporting Rand.
Clan chief of the Daryne Aiel. One of the younger chiefs following the Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Daryne Aiel. Works alongside the other chiefs in the campaign against the Shaido.
Clan chief of the Miagoma Aiel. Participates in military planning with the other loyal chiefs.
Clan chief of the Shaarad Aiel. Another chief who accepts Rand's leadership as Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Codarra Aiel. Joins the other chiefs in following the chosen one's campaign.
Maiden of the Spear assigned to guard Rand. Red-gold hair, sharp tongue, and fierce loyalty.
Maiden of the Spear, part of Rand's personal guard. Young and eager warrior with dark hair.
Maiden of the Spear guarding Rand. Beautiful and fallenly, treats him with mixture of respect and maternal care.
White-haired Maiden, leader of Rand's guard. Veteran warrior with great authority among the Maidens.
Maiden of the Spear in Rand's guard. Tall and serious, takes her duties very seriously.
Young Maiden of the Spear, part of the guard for the Car'a'carn. Eager to prove herself in battle.
Maiden of the Spear who becomes romantically involved with Mat. Tall and beautiful warrior.

30.description: Revealed to be a darkfriend, attempting to kill Mat before being discovered and stopped.

1.description: Stone Dog warrior who serves as one of Rand's personal guards. Tall Aielman with fierce loyalty.
Maiden of the Spear, first-sister to Chiad. Black hair and green eyes, fights alongside her companion.
Maiden of the Spear, first-sister to Bain. Red hair and gray eyes, inseparable from her companion.
Red Shield warrior serving with Rand's forces. Member of the Aethan Dor warrior society.

20.description: General from Arad Doman, one of the great captains. Small in stature but brilliant military mind.

35.description: Tairen High Lord who joins Rand's campaign. Arrogant and foolish, often more hindrance than help.
Young Tairen High Lord accompanying Rand. More reasonable than Weiramon but still prideful.
Cairhienin lord fighting in the siege. Member of noble house with claims to the Sun Throne.
Cairhienin noblewoman with strong ambitions for power. Beautiful and politically shrewd.
Cairhienin lord defending the city during the siege. Competent military commander and loyal.
Tairen High Lord with Rand's forces. Plotting and ambitious, seeks personal advancement.

30.description: Cairhienin lord who becomes one of Mat's most trusted officers in the Band of the Red Hand.
Tairen lord serving as officer in Mat's Band of the Red Hand. Young and eager for glory.
Experienced soldier and officer in the Band of the Red Hand. Grizzled veteran with tactical knowledge.

8.description: Former Illuminator now with the traveling show. Expert in fireworks and explosive devices.
Nynaeve's circus persona as a juggler, part of her disguise while hunting Black Ajah.
Elayne's assumed identity as a circus performer, hiding her noble birth and Aes Sedai training.
One of Latelle's trained bears in the circus. Large and somewhat temperamental performing bear.
Acrobat and tumbler in Luca's show. Sconfronted performer who does flips and aerial acts.
Horse trainer and groom with the circus. Takes care of the show's animals and performs with horses.
Fire-eater and sword swallower with the traveling show. Dangerous acts that thrill audiences.

32.description: Child of the Light officer serving under Pedron Niall. Young and idealistic Whitecloak.
Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light (Questioners). Secretly a Darkfriend serving multiple masters.
Whitecloak officer, fanatically devoted to the cause. Gaunt and intense, suspicious of everyone.
Young Whitecloak officer, son of the late Geofram Bornhald. More reasonable than many Children.
Whitecloak soldier serving in the Children of the Light. Regular soldier following orders.

15.description: Former Shienaran soldier who has become a fanatical preacher of the chosen one's divinity.

48.description: Brown Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Scholar and researcher, twin sister to Vandene.
Green Ajah sister with the Salidar rebels. Twin sister to Adeleas, shares scholarly interests.
Yellow Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Healer working against Elaida's authority.
Gray Ajah sister with the Salidar rebels. Appears to support the cause against Elaida.
Yellow Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Small in stature but strong in the One Power.
Yellow Ajah sister and former Sitter, now with Salidar rebels. Strong-willed and influential.
Blue Ajah sister and former Sitter now with the Salidar rebels. Ambitious and politically astute.
Yellow Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Dedicated to the cause against Elaida.
Green Ajah sister with the Salidar rebels. Battle-ready sister opposing Elaida's rule.
Brown Ajah sister among the Salidar rebels. Scholar dedicated to preserving knowledge.

26.description: Green Ajah sister and Arafellin noblewoman. Strong in the One Power and politically connected.
Green Ajah sister traveling with other Aes Sedai. Experienced in dealing with politics and war.
Green Ajah sister with two Warders. Emotional and impulsive, from Arafel.
Brown Ajah sister with scholarly manner. Appears absent-minded but is deeply knowledgeable.

49.description: Queen of Andor, controlled by Rahvin through Compulsion. Once strong ruler now manipulated puppet.

52.description: Freed from Compulsion when Rahvin faces danger, struggles to understand what happened to her.

49.description: Morgase's old nurse and closest advisor. Loyal servant trying to protect the queen.
Former innkeeper of The Queen's Blessing in Caemlyn. Now serves Morgase in the palace.
Palace guard loyal to Morgase. Recognizes something is wrong with the queen's behavior.

26.description: Former First Prince of the Sword of Andor, dismissed by Morgase. One of the great captains.

50.description: Recruited by Siuan to lead the Salidar rebel army against Elaida's White Tower.

49.description: Young woman who can see auras and images around people. Has been staying in Caemlyn.

52.description: Present during Rand's battle with Rahvin, sees visions of his possible futures.

15.description: One-eyed Shienaran soldier following Masema. Former member of Ingtar's party.
Shienaran soldier with Masema's followers. Uncomfortable with the religious fanaticism.

25.description: Former Warder who can communicate with wolves. Lives in the wilderness, bonded to wolf pack.

35.description: Saldaean noblewoman and hunter for the Horn. Married to Perrin Aybara.
Wolfbrother from Two Rivers, married to Faile. Can communicate with wolves and has golden eyes.
Young Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. Scholar and builder who travels with humans.
Ruler of Mayene, beautiful and politically astute. Uses her charm and intelligence to protect her nation.
Gray Ajah sister serving as Berelain's advisor. Sconfronted in negotiations and politics.
Captain of Berelain's Winged Guards. One-eyed soldier loyal to Mayene's First.

recaps.1: Rand leads the Aiel in pursuing Couladin and the Shaido across the Dragonwall, beginning a campaign to stop their depredations.
recaps.2: The Aiel war band crosses into the wetlands, shocking the people of Cairhien and Andor with their presence.
recaps.3: Political tensions rise as various kingdoms react to the Aiel invasion and Rand's role as Car'a'carn.
recaps.4: Asmodean continues teaching Rand about the One Power while disguised as the gleeman Jasin Natael.
recaps.5: The pursuit of the Shaido intensifies as reports of their raids and conquests spread across the continent.
recaps.6: Rand struggles with the responsibilities of leadership while learning to control his growing power.
recaps.7: The Aiel clans following Rand maintain their discipline while the Shaido under Couladin grow increasingly violent.
recaps.8: Nynaeve, Elayne, Thom, and Juilin join Valan Luca's traveling show as cover for their continued mission.
recaps.9: The circus provides both concealment and complications as the group tries to hunt Black Ajah while performing.
recaps.10: Valan Luca's romantic pursuit of Nynaeve creates additional problems for the disguised Aes Sedai hunters.
recaps.11: The traveling show encounters various dangers and political complications as it moves through troubled lands.
recaps.12: Egwene's training with the Aiel Wise Ones intensifies, particularly her development in Tel'aran'rhiod.
recaps.13: The World of Dreams becomes increasingly important as various factions use it for communication and warfare.
recaps.14: Political chaos spreads across multiple kingdoms as the effects of the chosen one's emergence grow.
recaps.15: The hunt for Black Ajah continues with the circus as cover, leading to dangerous encounters and discoveries.
recaps.16: Various plots and conspiracies begin converging as different groups pursue their conflicting goals.
recaps.17: The Aiel war band faces increasing resistance as they pursue the Shaido toward Cairhien.
recaps.18: Rand's relationship with Aviendha becomes more complex despite their attempts to maintain proper distance.
recaps.19: The siege of Cairhien intensifies as the Shaido surround the ancient city and threaten its destruction.
recaps.20: Sevanna's influence over the Shaido grows as she pushes them toward greater violence and conquest.
recaps.21: Political maneuvering continues as various rulers try to position themselves advantageously.
recaps.22: The crisis in Cairhien worsens as the city faces starvation and the Shaido tighten their siege.
recaps.23: Rand's forces approach Cairhien while the defending nobles struggle to maintain their resistance.
recaps.24: Preparations for the great battle intensify as multiple armies converge on the besieged city.
recaps.25: Valan Luca's continued romantic pursuit of Nynaeve creates increasingly awkward situations for everyone.
recaps.26: News of Siuan's deposition and Elaida's coup reaches various groups, shocking supporters of the old regime.
recaps.27: The political upheaval in the White Tower sends ripples throughout the Aes Sedai network.
recaps.28: Various factions react to the change in leadership at the White Tower, with some supporting and others opposing.
recaps.29: The crisis deepens as the implications of the Tower schism become clear to channelers worldwide.
recaps.30: Cerandin's Seanchan background becomes more apparent as she tries to contact her people.
recaps.31: Rand and Aviendha's relationship crosses new boundaries despite their cultural and duty-based conflicts.
recaps.32: Galad's membership in the Children of the Light creates new complications for his family relationships.
recaps.33: Pedron Niall's political maneuverings show his skill at manipulating continental chaos for Whitecloak benefit.
recaps.34: Nynaeve battles Moghedien in Tel'aran'rhiod, with Birgitte being ripped from the World of Dreams as consequence.
recaps.35: Birgitte's forced incarnation creates an unprecedented situation as a Hero of the Horn gains physical form.
recaps.36: The approach to Cairhien culminates as Rand's forces prepare for the decisive battle against the Shaido.
recaps.37: Egwene faces Lanfear in Tel'aran'rhiod, showing her growing skill and courage in dream battles.
recaps.38: Multiple dream confrontations occur as various factions use Tel'aran'rhiod for their conflicts.
recaps.39: The eve of the great battle arrives as all forces position themselves around besieged Cairhien.
recaps.40: Tensions reach their peak as the various armies prepare for what may be a decisive confrontation.
recaps.41: The Battle of Cairhien begins with Rand's forces engaging the Shaido in desperate combat.
recaps.42: The battle intensifies as ancient enemies clash while the fate of kingdoms hangs in the balance.
recaps.43: Mat's tactical genius shows as he leads cavalry charges that help turn the tide of battle.
recaps.44: Couladin is confronted by Mat, ending the false Car'a'carn's claim and breaking the Shaido resistance.
recaps.45: Victory at Cairhien comes at great cost, with many casualties among both Aiel and wetlander forces.
recaps.46: The aftermath of battle reveals new political alignments and the growing influence of Rand's rule.
recaps.47: Sevanna takes control of the surviving Shaido, vowing to continue their path of conquest and violence.
recaps.48: The Salidar rebels form as Aes Sedai opposed to Elaida gather to resist her illegitimate rule.
recaps.49: News of Rahvin's control over Andor reaches Rand, spurring him to action against the ancient enemy.
recaps.50: Siuan and Leane are healed of stilling by Nynaeve, though at reduced strength and with personality changes.
recaps.51: Preparations begin for Rand's assault on Caemlyn to face Rahvin and liberate Andor from ancient enemy control.
recaps.52: The climactic battles occur: Moiraine sacrifices herself against Lanfear while Rand fights and kills Rahvin.
recaps.53: Rahvin's fate by balefire unravels his recent actions, bringing back those he had confronted in the palace.
recaps.54: The political ramifications of Rahvin's fate and Andor's liberation spread throughout the continent.
recaps.55: New alliances and enmities form as the balance of power shifts following the major battles and fates.
recaps.56: Asmodean is found fallen, confronted by an unknown assassin, ending his role as Rand's reluctant teacher.
